intro: Chaetonychia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bristlebush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers surrounded by bristly, leaf-like structures. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
